Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior bears traces of a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394610) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394610)
